author: WBTV Web Staff
title: Chilly weekend ahead in Charlotte before warmer temps next week
text:
Chilly weekend ahead in Charlotte before warmer temps next week
Weekend to end cold, potentially rainy
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - A chilly weekend is ahead with warmer weather on the way next week.
Friday is starting off cold, with morning lows bottoming out in the upper 20s around Charlotte. Afternoon highs will reach the mid-50s with dry conditions in store; however, some clouds will move in.
Saturday will be similar to Friday, although morning temperatures will be about five degrees warmer. Highs will again be in the mid-50s with very little rain chance in Charlotte.
Potential for some scattered showers will re-enter the forecast Sunday, but the chance is not high. Any rain that does fall will likely not total very much. Highs will only reach about 50 degrees or a little below.
Monday will mark a return to the 60s, with highs forecast to reach the mid-60s both Tuesday and Thursday of next week.
